nodes.bodyText: Since we have so many other UUID fields, we probably don't need a separate natural key field.
will use id instead.
Why do we need two cleaners?   Can't we have just one?
changed.
This T type can be more specific.
T can be more specific here.
This doesn't seem to be called anywhere.
It's called in the AsyncExecutorService.
nitpick but we parse the query URL twice - once for the path and once for the headers.  We could combine these in a single parse.

We could make this non-abstract and expose it also as an Elide entity.  Benefits include:

Being able to see all the queries in one place
We can consolidate cleaners and cancel threads because they can query the base class (instead of the subclass).
Let's sync with Jon and agree on the names for these models.
This will not be an entity anymore. Navi is already using AsyncQuery and TableExport as the model names.
Add CreatePermission(NONE), DeletePermission(NONE) at the class level here.
Since this class is not an Entity anymore, we don't need it.
I wonder if we can move this logic outside the model and instead have it in a lifecycle hook.
Should the first param be AsyncAPI type?

I wonder if we should consolidate these three hooks into a single class.  A single hook can be called with different operation and phase arguments.  It might be more readable to have all the hook logic in one place.
We don't have the phase available during execute to allow consolidation.
You could make this method abstract instead of calling another method with the same signature.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,38 @@
+/*

+ * See LICENSE file in project root for terms.
+ */
+package com.yahoo.elide.async.service;
+
+import com.yahoo.elide.async.models.AsyncAPIResult;
+
+import org.apache.http.NoHttpResponseException;
+
+import lombok.Data;
+
+import java.net.URISyntaxException;
+import java.util.concurrent.Callable;
+
+/**
+ * Callable thread for executing the query provided in AsyncQuery and TableExport.
+ * It will also update the query status and result object at different
+ * stages of execution.
+ */
+@Data
+public abstract class AsyncAPIThread implements Callable<AsyncAPIResult> {
+
+    @Override
+    public AsyncAPIResult call() throws NoHttpResponseException, URISyntaxException {

nodes.bodyText: Is this class will be common for both AsyncQuery and TableExport - we need to name all the common classes with the same convention - AsyncAPI or AsyncBase or something along those lines.
Same comment on the class name here.
I would collapse this into the above processQuery method.
typo in variable name.
Any reason we moved this logic (requestUUId assignment) inside each executeX method?
I think with the new design, we should be able to remove this from the model - and tie it together elsewhere.
I think this should implement LifeCycleHook to create a "Is A" relationship here.
Can we remove this?
Mark final.
It looks like this can be created by the client.  We probably want to prohibit that.
I think you can remove this because of lombok.
This is an abstract class with no members and only a single method that implements an existing interface.  Do we need this separate class?

nodes.bodyText: It won't be safe to use null/not-null here to signify anything.  After the first threadlocal is initialized by a timeout, it will be non-null forever thereafter.

This could be missed because of an exception - and then Elide will remain in an invalid state.
Instead of using null/non-null - you'll need to keep track of something inside the threadlocal itself.
Maybe make this private and non-static if you can.
